title: Mesopotamia
truth1: 1) Mesopotamia was home to some of the world's first written laws, including the Code of Hammurabi.
truth2: 2) The Tigris and Euphrates Rivers provided fertile land for agriculture and allowed for the development of early civilizations in Mesopotamia.
lie: 3) Mesopotamia was known for its advanced use of electricity, with wind turbines and hydroelectric dams powering cities and industries.

title: Sumer
truth1: Sumerians invented the first form of writing using cuneiform symbols.
truth2: The Sumerian civilization existed in ancient Mesopotamia and developed advanced agricultural techniques.

title: Babylon
truth1: The Great Wall of China is the only man-made structure visible from space.
truth2: The tallest mountain in the solar system, Olympus Mons, is located on Mars.
lie: Babylon was the capital of ancient Mesopotamia and is still standing today as a thriving city.
